website_summaries.verdict: The Metcon Flyknit 3 received mixed feedback from the users. Some considered it a solid cross-trainer while others recommended going with the more popular Metcon versions for better performance.
pros: Many purchasers agreed that the Metcon Flyknit 3 was excellent for various types of fitness activities, including short runs, aerobics, and lifting
Most reviewers found the shoe comfortable for both gym use and simply walking around the streets
Its upper construction and the Flyknit material offered a snug, secure, and locked-in fit, according to a good number of users
More than a few people praised the footwear for hitting the right balance between flexibility for active workouts and sturdiness for weightlifting
cons: People with wider foot dimensions found the trainer too tight and narrow
Multiple reviews found the expensive price tag unjustified
They thought that the shoe did not offer better performance than the flagship Metcons at the same price
An expert did not recommend using the shoe for running due to its stiff platform

customer_reviews.title: Last pair of Nikes for me
customer_reviews.text: I only bought these because my son requested them. I am a consumer activist! I cannot stand Nike campaign and the people they hire to represent them. My son likes the look and comfort of the shoe but told him next time pick another brand or be disappointed when he doesn't get what he asks for.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly L. Spain

customer_reviews.title: Beware of fit
customer_reviews.text: Looks great and very sturdy. The sizing from heel to toe fits well to the size I normally wear. The only problem is that it is extremely tight across the top of the foot. I’ve been breaking them in but not sure how much it will loose up or if it even will.
customer_reviews.author: Jasen

customer_reviews.title: Fair price and very good seller
customer_reviews.text: Love this sneaker, the red compliments the shoe. Authentic, Comfortable, True to size after a few days of breakIng in. I’d refer to YouTube for an on feet, more detailed review. Shipping was super fast! The seller is reliable, helpful and responsive. I Look forward to buying another pair soon!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mayhem

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Gym Training Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Generally I use running shoes as they are nice and light when I go to the gym. Doing some research it seemed like the metcon line was the best way to go if trying something new that was more built for the gym. I took the advice of many reviews about going a half size up. They are now slightly big on me length wise but the width is good, so it's not a bad tradeoff. Would definitely recommend these shoes to anyone who spends time in the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Scott G.

customer_reviews.title: Poorly constructed....
customer_reviews.text: Bought my size (9) and couldn’t get my legs in at all. Exchanged for a next size and still a huge struggle to put the legs thru. Very tight and uncomfortable at the top of the leg area (under the laces)!
customer_reviews.author: Customer123

customer_reviews.title: Very tight, go up a full size
customer_reviews.text: Run really tight across the top and sides of your foot, if you buy these I highly recommend you go up a full size, I know they are supposed to be tight but when they cut off circulation when I’m sitting, that’s too tight. Great look, other than the tight fit I liked them a lot... but I returned them and did not buy a different size.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was hoping for
customer_reviews.text: I'm a size 9, but saw many reviews online that you should order 1/2 a size up so I got a 9.5 and it fit perfectly. I used them in my workout today for the first time and they provided great support. I plan on only using them for lifting purposes. I love how the shoe locks onto the heal area. I added a picture of what the shoes looked like when I first got them.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Great for WODs with heavy running
customer_reviews.text: Best CrossFit shoe I’ve owned so far. I’ve worn both Reebok Nanos and standard METCONS in the past but they were not nearly as comfortable when running during WODs. I wear a size 14 and sizing seemed pretty accurate. Only complaint would be that I wore the shoe out in roughly 4-5 months. However, considering 5-6 WODs a week, that’s pretty average I’d imagine.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Huling

customer_reviews.title: Hugs my foot nicely
customer_reviews.text: They run a bit small compared to other Nike's I've owned. But that works really great with my foot and these are the best gym shoes I've owned. Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes and fast shipping  did I say fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: Ordered and received in less than 24 hours so these shoes should make me run really fast. Now to the shoes they are great. Seen them on Nike website almost double the price I paid here so I figured something had to be wrong with them like one shoe 2x bigger than the other but they are perfect in fit and finish plus they are a good looking shoe. Buy them you won't regret it
customer_reviews.author: Scootertramp

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit
customer_reviews.text: Fake! Counterfeit! These were too small similar to many other reviews. I tried on a pair in a major retailer to confirm size ahead of ordering from Amazon to get the color I preferred. The shoes fit differently than the authentic Nikes which piqued my suspicion initially. Upon further review and comparison I discovered they were a poor counterfeit at best. I wish Amazon would do more to discourage counterfeits by punishing offenders.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Farmer

customer_reviews.title: it's ok..
customer_reviews.text: For someone who has a curved foot I do not recommend, it is very painful to ask me to remove the inner tongue for the shoe, or you should buy a larger size than what you usually wear..،
customer_reviews.author: Musab abdulaziz ibrahim

customer_reviews.title: Be careful of the material
customer_reviews.text: The white material in the shoe was like a thin cheap leather and I felt if wearing them it would have rip.
customer_reviews.author: Dewayne

customer_reviews.title: Describe well
customer_reviews.text: Lifestyle surprisingly comfortable your lights and love the material won't leave that crease like a leather wheel after using it a couple of times, really pleased
customer_reviews.author: Justo Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Very tight
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoes but these one are so tight ! My size is 11... Maybe 11.5 is better... At another point, one of the cords (picture)came somewhat deteriorated which is disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits as expected
customer_reviews.text: Didn't have to buy a half size up like a bunch of other reviews mentioned. My previous shoes were flynit so I'm familiar with their tight fit.
customer_reviews.author: null

customer_reviews.title: Design change does not allow for higher instep
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing metcons for years This design change does not allow for my high instep.
customer_reviews.author: CLIFFORD HAZELTINE

customer_reviews.title: Great sneaker - go a half size larger for the right fit.
customer_reviews.text: The sneaker looks great! As others have stated, go a half size up. My other Nikes are size 9.5 so I ordered a pair of these sneakers in that size - I could barely get my foot into it and once in, it was really tight in the middle. I returned it and purchased a size 10 - the fit is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a good buy
customer_reviews.text: It's a loose fit and the shoe damages your foot bridge without it being tight, just by wearing them. Do not recommend these shoes, better off with old DSX or normal metcons or other.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this shoe , fits perfectly and makes your feet look small very nice
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the shoes except they were used. I paid for new shoes definitely returning them.
customer_reviews.text: The shoes came worn and dog hair inside the shoes. The fit was right and I really like the shoe. I can’t speak much of the quality since i never got to actually wear them.
customer_reviews.author: Vera

customer_reviews.title: They fit perfectly and looks like it’s pic
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of the shoe and the colors
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Harris

customer_reviews.title: Box came damage but the she was intact.
customer_reviews.text: The box came damaged but the shoe was intact. It also looks authentic and is really comfortable and fits as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice and tight
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, although I would get a half a size larger then your normal size. I’ve even taken the laces completely out of my since the shoe itself is tight enough without them.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph F. Negrete

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought these in feb for running, they have completely fallen apart. Not happy!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Allie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for CrossFit workouts and am super satisfied - bought 3 pairs to rotate
customer_reviews.author: Lance F.

customer_reviews.title: Good timing
customer_reviews.text: Came in just like expected fit good just a little too big but he is growing boy so it works for him
customer_reviews.author: powerade

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Garbage! Expected more for the price tag! Done with Nike
customer_reviews.author: Ken Egan

customer_reviews.title: About the shoe
customer_reviews.text: Good shoe but the condition seems a little worn 😔 caution when spending over 100 dollars just go to the store.
customer_reviews.author: James Murry

customer_reviews.title: Great! Cool all black color.
customer_reviews.text: Great one, love the color. I got it all black. It’s feels a little weird when you walk. You will get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Alvaro G.

customer_reviews.title: Great for crosstraining
customer_reviews.text: Highly comfortable and functional crosstraining shoes, I have bought my second pair. Fits a little narrow, should be ordered in size +0.5 than regular Nike shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmet Saruhan

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I love lifting and doing conditioning in these shoes. They feel great and supportive.
customer_reviews.author: A Brown

customer_reviews.title: The most important thing to me is that the shoe will fit comfortably when I buy it
customer_reviews.text: I use this product for daily use the size fit perfect
customer_reviews.author: Colton Murray

customer_reviews.title: Fit as expected
customer_reviews.text: Received my shoe early they are exactly as described and very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Billy Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Nike shoes
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my son. He really likes the shoes
customer_reviews.author: Julia Kazin

customer_reviews.title: Runs a little small
customer_reviews.text: I’m normally a size 8 but ordered an 8.5 and they fit great.
customer_reviews.author: JC EKWALL

product_meta.title: Nike Men's Metcon Flyknit 3 Triathlon Shoes
product_meta.description: Men's cross training shoes from Nike brand. Model - Nike Metcon Flyknit 3. Reference AQ8022-001
feature_bullets: Flyknit upper delivers durable, yet lightweight flexibility. fit.
Synthetic overlays in high-wear areas such as the toe and lateral side enhance durability.
Molded flex grooves in the forefoot allow your foot to move naturally.
Flywire technology integrates into the laces at the midfoot for a dynamic fit that helps keep your foot in place without restricting natural movement.
Firm rubber in the heel provides durability and stability for high-intensity intervals.
